{"step_by_step_thinking": "The documents discuss changes in collagen and proteoglycans during osteoarthritis. Cartilage and osteoarthrosis: changes of collagen and proteoglycans states that during osteoarthritis the proteoglycan molecule diminishes in size, mainly due to a diminution of the carbohydrate portion. This leads to changes in the interaction with hyaluronic acid. Collagen is more soluble and has a reduced resistance to proteolytic enzymes. Additionally, The collagens of articular cartilage states that collagen type I and III are present in osteoarthrotic cartilage, which suggests that there are changes in the composition of the collagen matrix.", "answer_choice": A}
